DefaultEvent.Description: If Lorenzo had remained on the Surface, he could have died a simple death and been buried in the rain. Now he hasn't even got a corpse to call his own. The Incomparable Aurelian sighs. "Look where his ambitions got him. Idiocy. Better to enjoy the span we're given and face its end with honesty." He closes his collection book with a leaden thud.
DefaultEvent.Name: A death by degrees and devolution

ChildBranches.Name: Tell him Lorenzo lost
ChildBranches.Description: An honest death would have been better than what he endured.

DefaultEvent.Description:
Life is unreliably pleasant, but it's better than the alternative. Lorenzo found a way to prolong it. It was, after all, why he came to the Neath. 

The Incomparable Aurelian sighs. "He has a new life now. Maybe a happier one." He closes his collection book with a quiet smile.
DefaultEvent.Name: A triumph over death, albeit a messy one

ChildBranches.Name: Tell him Lorenzo triumphed
ChildBranches.Description: Some part of him eluded death; he lives on.

Description:
Looking up from his book of pressed moths, the Incomparable Aurelian fixes you with his stare.

"Lorenzo came to the Neath looking for a way to cheat death. I can't say whether or not he succeeded."
Name: A fate worse than death?
